content.description: Thin crack which runs up left facing corner past small overhang 8 feet off of the ground.
content.protection: protects fairly well with trad gear or you can top rope from anchors.
content.location: Crack to the right of bucketland which starts on a suspended block.

content.description: Crux is about six feet off the ground utilizing a series of underclings.  Also nice liebacking above the crux area and some interesting moves above.
content.protection: Multiple anchors as well as trees on top can be used  for top rope.  Would lead fairly well with trad gear.
content.location: First route past the break in lower hidden rocks, in the corner.  You can walk around and up to the top in order to set the TR.

content.description: Climb the successive overhangs off to the R of the chimney. Fairly sustained difficulty once you hit the overhangs.
content.protection: Normal trad rack.   Top rope via anchors recommended.
content.location:
Lower Hidden Rocks: #4 from R.  

  Route is in between 'Rainy Day Woman' and 'Sky's Mike and Eddie's Roof. Line is just off to the R of the chimney.

content.description:
Start below diehedral/crack right of Snowblower.  Work your way up to the roof through blocky overhanging terrain.  Ascend the dihedral/overhang through a wide crack. once you are above the roof, climb up and left towards a pin, past a good 3" horizontal crack.  climb a nice 9+ crux on face moves past the pin, and then up the bucket strewn face to the top.  Finishes right of Snowblower. 

  Rhodey Corner (FA Mike Artz in early 80s) climbs the same start and continues up the vegetated corner/crack.  It was the first route put up at lower hidden.  Originally graded 5.8
content.protection: Normal trad rack, one fixed pin (lost arrow still in good shape)
content.location: Start @ obvious left facing corner system right of Snowblower, then head left onto orange face past a pin.  Finishes 10' right of Snowblower.

climbs.name: Snowblower
climbs.fa: FA by Mitch Congdon & Paul Sullivan - 1990

content.description: One of the original lines at Hidden, and considered a classic here.
Climb the protruding face through the high overhang.
content.protection: Normal trad rack, with some smaller pieces.   Top rope via anchors.
content.location:
Lower Hidden Rocks: #2 from R. 

  Route is in between 'Mike and Eddie's Roof' and 'Cool Fool'. Look for the tree with two trunks.

climbs.name: Rainy Day Woman
climbs.fa: Dean Metzler, Keith Filter, Mitch Congdon, Paul Sullivan - 1987

content.description: Route ascends obvious chimney to roof.  At the roof, climb up and right (crux) to gain a horizontal crack (get gear here).  then ascend a steep crack/seam with tricky gear to the top.  Sustained climbing and tricky pro make this a tough lead.
content.protection: Standard trad rack and some brassies for the finish
content.location: Starts 10' right of Rhodey Corner/Steamroller in obvious chimney.

content.description: Climb through the low roof, and up past the overhang. Steep and pumpy.
content.protection: Normal trad rack, with smaller-to-medium pieces.   Top rope via anchors.
content.location:
Lower Hidden Rocks: #3 from R.  

  Route is in between 'Toprope This!' and 'Sky's the Limit'. Line is just off to the L of the bulging corner.

content.description: Starts with short right facing corner to thiner face to blocky bulges with at least one piton about 25 feet up.
content.protection: 1 piton, crack in the begining, would be a very spicy lead I think.  Anchors on top could be used for TR with extensions and directional.
content.location: Just to the right of thin crack in the middle of green rock.

content.description: - traverse cliff base to end at Cool Fool
content.location: starts about 25 feet left of Snowblower

content.description: Climb into the big rectangular hole, then follow the crack straight up. Crux is passing the wide section between two little roofs.
content.location: Obvious crack left of Bucketland and Lil' Bubba with big rectangular hole down low

content.description: - start from block just right of tree   - climb blocky face around right side of high overhang
Easy, featured slab up to a ledge which has a high step that might be the crux
content.protection: two anchors at top, bring runners or something to extend because there are crack which can pinch the rope.
content.location: second section of lower hidden on obvious less steep section.  Look for featured slab.

content.description: First set of climbs that you come to on the trail.  At least 13 climbs with variations and Snowblower (5.9+)
